a cannon and the crowd were dragging it out. A cannon ball killed someone behind them, an- other fell in front and splashed D61okhov with blood. The crowd, pushing forward desperate- ly, squeezed together, moved a few steps, and again stopped. 
"Move on a hundred yards and we are cer- tainly saved, remain here another two minutes and it is certain death," thought each one. 
D61okhov who was in the midst of the crowd 
forced his way to the edge of the dam, throw- ing two soldiers off
